docs.lead_paragraph: With their party on offense in its push to capture the Senate, Republicans say they are determined to avoid the mistakes and stumbles that Democrats exploited in 2010 and 2012.

docs.lead_paragraph: For many older Americans who lost jobs during the recession, the quest for health care has been one obstacle after another. They're unwanted by employers, rejected by insurers, struggling to cover rising medical costs and praying to reach Medicare age before a health crisis.

docs.lead_paragraph: Former AIG boss Maurice "Hank" Greenberg's Starr Investment Holdings LLC said on Monday it had agreed to take over health insurance claims processor MultiPlan Inc in what is by far its biggest private equity investment to date.

headline.main: Greenberg's Starr Leads $4.4 Billion MultiPlan Acquisition
headline.print_headline: Greenberg's Starr Leads $4.4 Billion MultiPlan Acquisition

headline.print_headline: C.V. Starr and Partner Buy Health Care Concern in a $4.4 Billion Deal

docs.abstract: A group of investors led by an affiliate of Maurice R. Greenberg and the Swiss investment firm Partners Group announced on Monday that it had acquired MultiPlan.

headline.print_headline: Writers Guild Plans Forum on Affordable Care Act

docs.abstract: Crowd of 100 or so screenwriters and others are expected to gather at headquarters of Writers Guild of America East to hear thoughts about Affordable Care Act and its place in comedy and drama; seminar is drawing criticism as potential propaganda-fest in favor of law.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a church service in Albany, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo was joined by Mayor Bill de Blasio, in town for the New York State Black, Puerto Rican, Hispanic and Asian Legislative Caucus Weekend.

headline.main: De Blasio Strikes Conciliatory Note on Pre-K
headline.print_headline: Mayor Strikes Conciliatory Note on Pre-K

docs.abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo is joined by New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio for New York State Black, Puerto Rican, Hispanic and Asian Legislative Caucus Weekend in Albany; de Blasio strikes conciliatory note with other mayors in state, saying all children deserve full-day prekindergarten; remarks are response to barrage of emails accusing him of favoring New York City children over those in cities like Niagara Falls and Yonkers.
docs.snippet: At a church service in Albany, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo was joined by Mayor Bill de Blasio, in town for the New York State Black, Puerto Rican, Hispanic and Asian Legislative Caucus Weekend.

docs.lead_paragraph: Are hidden cameras a violation of patients’ right to privacy?
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by bioethicist Tim Lahey questions use of video monitoring equipment in hospitals; says while use of cameras is in some cases defensible in interest of patient safety, it can in other instances border on violation of privacy and patient trust; holds use of hidden cameras should be last resort, and that patients should be informed of their possible use.
docs.snippet: Are hidden cameras a violation of patients’ right to privacy?
